text: The President of Kyrgyzstan is the head of state and the highest official of the Kyrgyz Republic. The president is directly elected for no more than one six-year term by the Kyrgyz electorate. The office of president was created in 1990. The office of president is open to all citizens of Kyrgyzstan who are no younger than 35 years of age, and no older than 65 years of age.Kyrgyz Constitution, article 45, §3 ==List of presidents== list of heads of state of Kyrgyzstan I# A# Name Picture Took office Left office Political party 1 1. 1991 Askar Akayev Аскар Акаев (1944–) 27 October 1990 29 October 1995 Independent 2 1995 29 October 1995 29 October 2000 3. 2000 29 October 2000 24 March 2005 (ousted) 3. 2000 – Ishenbai Kadyrbekov Ишенбай Кадырбеков (Acting) (1949–) 24 March 2005 25 March 2005 Independent 3. 2000 2 Kurmanbek Bakiyev Курманбек Бакиев (1949–) 25 March 2005 14 August 2005 Independent 4. 2005 14 August 2005 15 October 2007 People's Movement of Kyrgyzstan 4. 2005 15 October 2007 23 July 2009 Ak Jol 5. 2009 23 July 2009 7 April 2010 (ousted) Ak Jol 3 5. 2009 Roza Otunbayeva Роза Отунбаева (1950–) 7 April 2010 (self-proclaimed) 3 July 2010 Social Democratic Party of Kyrgyzstan 5. 2009 Roza Otunbayeva Роза Отунбаева (1950–) 3 July 2010 1 December 2011 4 6. 2011 Almazbek Atambayev Алмазбек Атамбаев (1956–) 1 December 2011 24 November 2017 Social Democratic Party of Kyrgyzstan 5 7. 2017 Sooronbay Jeenbekov Сооронбай Жээнбеков (1958–) 24 November 2017 15 October 2020 Social Democratic Party of Kyrgyzstan – 7. 2017 Sadyr Japarov Садыр Нургожоевич Жапаров (1968–) 15 October 2020 Incumbent Mekenchil ==References==
title: President of Kyrgyzstan
